fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41810].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:
# Go to EAN (https://ecosystem.atlassian.net)
# Edit an issue, or create a new issue
# Look at the new formatting bar
# Select a line of text
# Click "Bold"
# Notice the text is now surrounded by asterisks
# Deselect the line of text, do something else
# Now select the entire line, including the asterisks
# Click "Bold" again
# Notice that extra asterisks have been added. I would expect the ones that are already there to be removed

It seems like the "unformat" function only works if you don't select the formatting characters. That is if I have {{\*foo\*}} and I select just {{foo}} then it will work. If I select the entire text then I end up with {{\*\*foo\*\*}}.
fields.summary: New JIRA formatting bar doesn't "unformat"
Change default data location to the Common Application Data Folder
Notification Helper says that SD user will receive notifications, but they do not

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41806].
  {panel}

JIRA allows [priority|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Priority+Field+Values] and [issue type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values] icons to be customised, but they are stored by default on the <JIRA_INSTALL> folder structure (e.g. usually on {{<jira-application-dir>/images/icons}}).
Our current documentation does not include steps to migrate these files:
- [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually]
- [Upgrading JIRA with a Fallback Method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+with+a+Fallback+Method]
- [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server#MigratingJIRAtoAnotherServer-configuringnewjiraasold]

We should update our documentation to cover such scenario.
fields.summary: The JIRA upgrade documentation should cover the migration of custom icons
Enable Entity Properties to be set using the IssueService for create

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41799].

In my jira project I can have a several user groups and just one owner of filter.

How to make different groups of users can modify and save the filter? 
Filter owner can assign these groups?
I really need this feature, implement please.
fields.summary: The owners of the filter - several groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41798].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have the ability to set a notification to send to a group but then Exclude (or Except) certain users or possibly even other groups.
For example:
Dev group: User1, User2, User3, User4, User5, User6, User7
Mgmt group: User6, User7
Notify Dev group except for Mgmt group
Notify Dev group except for User6
fields.summary: Add Exclude feature to Notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41797].
  {panel}

When connecting to different JIRA or Confluence servers you start haivng duplicate gadgets from different instances.

At this moment is quite hard to distinguish one from another and a huge number of users are reporting inssues just because they do not see the different URL.

This is happening due to the current bad design of how gadget are listed.
You need to perform some changes in the UI that would make it clear what is the data-source.

I would advise on listing the data source as a category in the left menu, it would much easier for people to pick the right gadget this way.
fields.summary: gadget source is not clear and confuses users

fields.description:
The Drag and drop attachment plugin does not take it's max value from the JIRA Attachment Size.

Irrespective of the size set by user on JIRA, it will always revert to the original 10MB when user uses the drag and drop attachment plugin to upload files.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin Does not respect JIRA Attachment Size

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Add new User Directory. I used Microsoft AD and already had another Microsoft AD and the internal user directory
2.  Save and Test the new AD user directory. Full sync not Incremental
3.  Change the order so the new user directory is second
4. Click on the Synchronize link

Expected Result:
Last synchronised at Mon Jan 26th 3:59pm (took 0s).

Actual Result:
Last synchronised at {lastStartTime} (took 0s).

The variable lastStartTime is probably missing a leading $ character
fields.summary: Template string not replaced in User Directory status message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41791].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# On JIRA have Activity Stream on your dashboard
# Log work on some issue with a description

*Expected Results:*
# The Activity Stream would show up this activity with the description of the entry. E.g.:
{noformat}Elisa Diel [Administrator] updated 2 fields of HHH-2 - Testing
Changed the Remaining Estimate to '0 minutes'
Description testing LogWork entry on AS.{noformat}

*Actual Results:*
# The Activity Stream doesn't show any description of the activity. 
E.g.:
{noformat}Elisa Diel [Administrator] updated 2 fields of HHH-2 - Testing
Changed the Remaining Estimate to '0 minutes'
Logged '1 hour'{noformat}

*Notes:*
According to https://design.atlassian.com/2.0/product/patterns/activity-stream the add-on should detail the information as shown in the "Complex Items" entries.
fields.summary: Activity Stream won't show comment on LogWork

fields.description:
I have imported the "jira-project" module (among others) in Eclipse and it fails to compile with the following errors:

1) 
"The interface Builder cannot be implemented more than once with different arguments: WorkflowSchemeStore.State.Builder<AssignableWorkflowSchemeStore.AssignableState.Builder> and WorkflowSchemeStore<AssignableWorkflowSchemeStore.AssignableState>.State.Builder<AssignableWorkflowSchemeStore.AssignableState.Builder>"

The class in question is com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OfBizAssignableWorkflowSchemeStore.DefaultWorkflowSchemeStateBuilder

2) "The return type is incompatible with DefaultVelocityManager.createContextParams(String, Map<String,Object>)"
Class : com.atlassian.velocity.JiraVelocityManager

3) "Type mismatch: cannot convert from ImmutableList<capture#6-of ? extends Fieldable> to Iterable<Fieldable>"
Class: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.indexers.impl.IssuePropertySearchExtractor
fields.summary: jira-core won't compile under Eclipse

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41789].
  {panel}

In the old version of JIRA (5.x), a *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* gadget can display more information without having to scroll as the columns are narrower. In JIRA 6, the columns became wider and users will have to scroll right to view. It would be better that the columns remain as narrow as possible so as much information can be displayed.

For example, if you have a workflow with the following statuses
* Open
* In Progress
* Reopened
* Resolved
* Closed
* Analysing
* Escalated

In JIRA 5.x, you can see information from Open until Escalated without having to scroll right. In JIRA 6.x, you can only see information up to Closed. For Analysing and Escalated, users must scroll right. This can be pretty inconvenient.
fields.summary: Columns for Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget to be Narrower

fields.description:
Dear Jira Support Team

We've got a serious Problem.
We're unable to set any Date (important for us is specially the Due Date) to any period in March. We're working with the System Language German where March is translated to März.
We think it's an issue with the "Umlaut".

Could you please fix this asap, so we can use the Due Date again ?

Sincerly
fields.summary: Due Date March (März) in German Environement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41787].
  {panel}

***Summary***
The screenshot and steps of [*Creating an issue type*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype] need to be updated.

We have updated the process of uploading custom issue type icon. In the previous version, customers can provide icon URL to upload their custom issue type icon. We have updated the issue type icon configuration that customer can upload the custom icon via their local device (Computer). Please refer to this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype].

***Steps to reproduce***
# Sign in to JIRA.
# Click on *Cog* icon.
# Select *Issues*.
# Click on *Issue Types* on the left navigation bar.
# Click *Add Issue Type*.
# You will find this page !Add_Issue_Type_Box.png|thumbnail!
# The documentation still showing with the URL icon field. Please refer to this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype].
# This also happened to JIRA Cloud application, Please refer to this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype].
fields.summary: Creating an issue type documentation needs some update

fields.description:
Issue created from *CP1252* encoding or character set is decode correctly.

For example, you will see all character change to '?' characters:
!office365.png|thumbnail!

You can diagnose the email by checking the headers:
{code}
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=WINDOWS-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
{code}

This behavior will happen when user send email from Office 365 to your Incoming Mail Server. But, the problem is not happen in Gmail.

*Finding:*
Changing File Encoding to UTF-8 is not helping - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/International+Characters+in+Notification+E-mail+Subjects
fields.summary: Incoming email from CP1252 encoding is not decode correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a custom field with a drop down list is located towards the bottom of the screen, clicking on the field will cause the drop down to appear on the right instead. Is this intentional behaviour?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a field (or use the *Component* field)
# Enter a lot of values for the field (I tested with 26)
# Add the field to a screen (eg. create issue), placing it towards the bottom of the screen
# Create an issue which will display that screen. The field will be found towards the bottom. Click on that field

h3. Expected Results
The drop down list will appear and it is aligned with the field.

h3. Actual Results
The drop down list will appear but it is aligned to the right
!Selection_315.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
# If you place the field higher up on the screen, the problem won't happen
# Even reproducible in https://jira.atlassian.com

h3.Workaround
Place the field higher up on the screen
fields.summary: Down down list of a field is aligned to the right of the screen if the field is near bottom of the screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41775].
  {panel}

We are soon phasing out Jelly in JIRA 6.4 but the documentation for 6.4 does not reflect this. Example : 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Jelly+Tags
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Jelly+Escalation
(i) There could be other docs as well.

In fact these docs should not exist for 6.4 since Jelly is completely getting removed in JIRA 6.4. We should add a warning in all the other versions of JIRA.

Currently, there is no warning to inform the customers about this change.
fields.summary: JIRA Jelly documentation needs to be updated

fields.description:
Hello guys, I guess I just found out a bug :/

Requirements : Having a text Customfield and also have possibility to change project/issuetype on create issue screen.

To reproduce :
# Go to *Dashboard*
# Click on *Quick Create* button
# Fill *Summary* and text CF with values : !before.jpg|thumbnail!
# Change either issuetype or project value !during.jpg|thumbnail!
# text CF value has been reset whereas Summary value is still populated : !after.jpg|thumbnail!

Actually, all customfield values already selected before changing issuetype/project value are not kept.

I made some debug already and I detected that _customFieldValuesHolder_ parameter passed into
{code}
public static Map<String, Object> buildParams(CustomField customField, FieldConfig config, Issue issue, FieldLayoutItem fieldLayoutItem, Object value, Map customFieldValuesHolder, Action action, Map displayParameters)
{code}
of *CustomFieldUtils* class (before calling *getVelocityParameters* from customfield type class) doesn't contain customfield selected value from QuickCreate form.

Don't hesitate to ask for some other details if you need it.

Cheers

Brice
fields.summary: Customfields value is cleared when changing issuetype/project value on Quick Create

fields.description:
bq. Change to project creation in JIRA: Creating a new project now creates a project-specific issue type scheme, workflow scheme, screen scheme and issue type screen scheme for that project. This change applies to all project types, except for the 'JIRA Classic' project type, which still uses the shared default JIRA schemes when used to create a new project. This change is to enable more flexibility around editing JIRA schemes on a per project basis.

Not sure if this was intentional or not, but the behavior of the soap interface should continue to be *classic* and not follow the new method. 

How would one request *classic* mode? Still no REST api for project creation, but, I would imagine it could provide more options on how the project creation should behave.

Environment: JIRA 6.4-m22-2.
fields.summary: SOAP createProjectFromObject on 6.4 not compatible with 6.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41771].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Streamlining+your+development+with+JIRA

In this document, this is all that is said about GitHub:

"GitHub
You can configure the DVCS Connector plugin in JIRA in order to see branch, commits and pull request information in the Development panel of a JIRA issue."

It states that the connector can see a branch. However, it should be made more clear that the DVCS Connector for GitHub does not have the ability create branches. By omission, it essentially says this, but the document should be explicit. The ability to create branches exists within Atlassian products only, and not with a connection to GitHub.
fields.summary: Add that we don't allow creating branches with GitHub to our Docs
"inltokxyzkdtnhgnsbdfinltok0inltokxyzkdtnhgnsbdfinltok" appears to be a mysterious macro that duplicates content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41769].
  {panel}

As a project administrator using an OnDemand\Cloud JIRA instance, I would like to be able to add pre-scripted comments to tickets as part of a workflow transition so that I don't need to prompt my users for the same notes over and over.

I feel like this may have been asked already, but I can't find the ticket. What I'm looking for is the ability to pre-define a comment as a post-function and then have this comment added to the ticket as it passes through the transition. I realize this is possible using scripts, but as an OnDemand user those options aren't open to me, and this _appears_ to be a pretty simple ask. It would be a bonus to be able to put in short codes with current_user, date\time, etc.

My use-case:
We have a "QA" status during which our QA people do their thing, and either pass the ticket along or send it back to devs for more work. We prompt them for a comment either way, but if they're passing it the comment is almost always the same ("Passed QA").
fields.summary: Add Pre-Defined Comment to Ticket During Transition for OD\Cloud Instances
Who support NAMO

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41755].
  {panel}

We use JIRA to run our business due to it's flexibility and range of plugins.
We use Tempo to log time for billing, and for traffic management for our project and retainer jobs across two physical offices 100's of kilometers apart.

The issue with UTC v local time is causing us headaches from compliance overheads as people have to manually go back and reenter timesheet entries.

A switchable option for UTC/local is a vital feature for us.

We are also looking at Project Online as a PMO/tracking system - and this would exacerbate our issues.
fields.summary: Upvoting JRA-35503

:)

fields.description:
It appears that a race condition happens when you try to load several projects at once.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Go to the Browse Project page (_Projects > View All Projects_).
# Open several projects on new tabs or windows.

h4. Actual results.

Projects will not load properly. Project Name, Issue Key, Avatar will be from a different project. If you reload the page once all projects are loaded, then it will load properly.

h4. Expected results:

All projects load properly.

h4. Workaround:

There is not a workaround. Avoid opening too many projects at once.
fields.summary: Race condition when opening several projects

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new project
# Create an issue in the project
# Resolve the issue and in the resolve issue screen, add value in the *Time Spent* field to log work

h4. Expected Results
# Worklog and Resolved will be in the same event
# Only one notification sent to users

h4. Actual Results
# Worklog and Resolved are 2 separate events
!1.png|thumbnail!
# 2 separate emails are sent with the following subjects
#* admin added a worklog on Bug TEST-2
#* admin resolved Bug TEST-2 as Fixed
fields.summary: Adding worklog while Resolving/Closing issues is considered 2 separate events thus sending 2 separate notifications

fields.description:
When editing a project role that has over 400 members, the request generated to complete the edit will throw a 400-BAD REQUEST error in the browser. This is due to the fact that the request URL is too long, over 7000 characters and must be hitting a certain kind of limit. 

Steps to reproduce:
# Install the Data Generator plugin: [from Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-data-generator]
# Generate 420 users.
# Add all users to one project role. 
# Observe that at around ~400 users, the bad request error is thrown.

Tested on *Chrome* and *Firefox*.

Example request looks like this:
{noformat}
http://localhost:8085/jira/rest/api/1.0/users/picker?showAvatar=true&query=hh&exclude=ayhqevlty&exclude=admin&exclude=ajtldeaor&exclude=ahkzxyhrj&exclude=acjtvurzv&exclude=artqxyhcq&exclude=agubkmuaz&exclude=antkmjlxr&exclude=apgjpjway&exclude=etc. etc...
{noformat}
Notice the need to add the *exclude* parameter to the URL for each user in the Project Role list.

Attached request headers: [^Request Headers.txt]
Attached response headers: [^Response Headers.txt]
fields.summary: Large amount of project role users can cause Bad Requests when trying to edit that role's members
Allow search by issue key without the dash
Update 6.3 Stable to bundle Service Desk 2.2
Update logic of "earliestUnreleasedVersion()" to use earliest date
Bump UPM version in JIRA from 2.17.13 to 2.18.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41736].
  {panel}

At the moment, the only way to associate project in the custom field context is through UI in *Custom field* > *Configure* > and refer to *Choose applicable context*

The problem happens when the instance has huge number of projects and a long list of custom fields to be associated with each project. 
- With the limited number of project visible in the context dialog box at a time, the process becomes troublesome. 
- Furthermore, The projects are listed alphabetically, which means that the users need to scroll down to find the desired project. 
- If the users wrongly click the project, the chance is that the previous selected projects can get deselected. 

These are a fews option how we can improve this:
- We can list the newly created project on the top of the list, which will make it easier for the user to refer to
- Have the option of how many projects can be visible in that context dialog box at a time
- Have the bulk operation for this
fields.summary: Improve the procedure to associate project in custom field context
JIRA Mobile does not work with iPad
Rearrange tabs in Agent View
Populate Epic Name with Summary when Bulk Edit Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41730].
  {panel}

Currently, our [Starting a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Starting+a+Sprint] documentation states:
bq. You will need to have the JIRA 'Administer Projects' permission in the project(s) whose issues are to be included in the new sprint. This means that if your board includes issues from multiple projects, you need to have the 'Administer Projects' permission in each of those projects.

This can cause confusion, as the behavior is that the user must be a project administrator of all projects included in the board - independent to which issues are being added to the sprint. Hence, I'm changing the above note to:
bq. You will need to have the JIRA 'Administer Projects' permission in the project(s) included in the board. This means that if your board includes issues from multiple projects, you need to have the 'Administer Projects' permission in each of those projects.
fields.summary: Review Changes to the 'Starting a Sprint' Documentation
Cannot get temporary attachments as formToken is NULL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41728].
  {panel}

Problem:
Since we upgraded from JIRA 5.2 to 6.3.12 on 23.11.2014, we see that the work logged within JIRA (or Tempo in our case) is shown in the History tab of each issue. This was not the case in the older JIRA version.
We updated to JIRA 6.3.13 to get rid of the worklog emails, but 6.3.13 did not change the History tab problem.

Reason:
For us, it is important that Work Log entries  are only visible to concerned persons in the company. This typically are project leaders and accounting. All others should not see the worklog of others. It is OK and helpful to see ones own work logs.

Background:
Tempo does a good job in hiding work logs from others. It has permissions for time sheets that fit our needs. But at the JIRA level, this high appreciated level of privacy seems to get lost: Activity Streams show worklog entries, History Tabs show worklog entries. Both shall be hidden to users without permission to do so. We managed to hide Activity Streams (which was a long struggle and not all participants were lucky with the found solution).

This is also a legal issue: In Europe, personal data must be treated in a special way. This is enforced by national and european laws. As I understand it, the current behaviour of JIRA is not conform to European law, because work logs can be seen by people that are not involved with processing this data.

Expected Solution:
The worklog entries should be removed from the history tab for users that do not have the required permission for this. "Issue View" permission is not the right permission to use as well as "Edit All Worklogs". A "View All Worklogs" permission (vs. "View Own Worklogs") would be fine.
fields.summary: Time Spent entries show up in History tab

fields.description:
In a scenario where the Issue Type of Jira has been renamed (or the same name, but different case). 
The REST Query to get list of issue types : [ http://jira-server:9090/rest/api/2/issuetype ] returns the value of Issue Name that existed before the update.

In our case, we renamed the Bug to BUG.
The query for list of issue type in JIRA returns Bug.
But using this return value to fetch list of fields meta [ http://jira-server:9090/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=SP&issuetypeNames=Bug&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields ] from Jira, empty list is returned. Whereas the same second query but with value as BUG returns proper value.

Thus, Jira expects/returns Issue Name differently at different instances.
fields.summary: Fetching fields meta does not work when issue type has been renamed

fields.description:
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Use *{{xyz_abc/d4ef_123_ghi/jkl}}* in any Text field that supports Wiki Style Renderer e.g. Summary, Comment, Description
 # Run this JQL: text ~ xyz
 ->  FOUND
 # Run this JQL: text ~ abc
 -> NOT FOUND
 # Run this JQL: text ~ d4ef
 -> NOT FOUND
 # Run this JQL: text ~ 123
 -> NOT FOUND
 # Run this JQL: text ~ ghi
 -> FOUND
 # Run this JQL: text ~ jkl
 -> FOUND

{panel}
(-) It looks like that, searching for a Text block _adjacent to (probably the left of)_ *another Text block containing a Number* doesn't work, if:
 * they're separated by a Special character e.g. Forward Slash ( / ) or Underscore ( _ ) or Dash \(-)
 * the Text block to search contains a number itself

(i) Behaviors might slightly vary depending on the contents of the Text block or usage of Special characters.
{panel}
fields.summary: Strange behaviors of Contains ( ~ ) operator when searching for Text blocks

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41712].
  {panel}

 Currently you can change the global default timeout for all users via the web.xml located in your <InstallationFolderLocation>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/web.xml.  (see example below in quotes) to the desired time out:
"<session-config>
<session-timeout>300</session-timeout>
</session-config>. 

[Changing default timeout session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Changing+the+default+session+timeout"]

However you cannot do it per user.
fields.summary: Add the ability to modify  modify the user timeout variable per user

fields.description:
JIRA documentation states that the xml backup job that runs in JIRA is scheduled based off of the system's most recent start-up.  This seems to have changed in JIRA 6.3.  In 6.3, the backup service start time cannot be reset by restarting the system.  Rather, it seems to retain the date/time the system was first started.  

There is a workaround where you can reset the service's start time by editing the interval using the system's UI.  The start time will be set to the time that the interval edit was committed.
fields.summary: XML backup service start time is not reset on start-up.
Improve UPM install/uninstall addons documentation
Sort custom fields in Excel (All Fields) issue navigator view alphabetically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41705].
  {panel}

When editing a project permission scheme, its quick to grant *Users / Groups / Project Roles* access to any or all available permissions via the Add link under Operations. 

However, reversing that process isn't possible. Taking the *Browse Projects* permission as our example. As admin, I want to keep the admin group and remove everything else:

- Single User (John Doe) (Delete)
- Single User (Jane Doe) (Delete)
- Project Role (Developers) (Delete)
- Project Role (atlassian-addons-project-access) (Delete)
- Project Role (Clients) (Delete)
- Project Role (Users) (Delete)
- Group (administrators) (Delete)

Retaining Group (administrators), I would need to click the Delete link 6 times. I would then proceed to the next project permission and do the same, which could equate to being a non trivial administrative task. 

Ideally we could streamline deleting project permissions by providing admins with the ability to bulk delete.
fields.summary: Bulk Delete Project Permissions
Allow Pull Request Comment to Transition a JIRA Issue

fields.description:

Hi

I have filled in the Support request [JSP-216643|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JSP/issue/JSP-216643] and looks like found some solution that can improve the multi select lists in Jira.

I have a situation when I need to edit the different settings in Jira and especially in Custom Fields settings configuration I am facing problem that the project list has very tiny visible area and does not have resizing functionality.

I would like to offer 2 changes:

# Add the "resize: vertical" to the multi select objects style
# At least show the 5-10% of the projects list

I have a situation that the list is showing only 5 lines when I have 800 projects in the Jira instance so it is about 0.625% which is quite not UI friendly at all.

Regards,
Areg
fields.summary: Project list length in Custom Field context configuration

fields.description:
h4.Summary
In parent issue, when displaying the value of a custom field of a subtask (following this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=163939652]), the value is not properly aligned. 

For example;
if the value is "test test test", it will be displayed in 3 rows
!notcorrect.png|thumbnail!
if the value is "test_test_test", it will be displayed in 1 row
!correct.png|thumbnail!

jira.table.cols.subtasks will consider anything after *space* or *- (dash)* as the next word. Thus, it will go to the next row. The size of the column seems to be dynamic.

h4. Additional information
- Was tested and reproducible in JIRA 5.2.4 and JIRA 6.3
- Was tested and reproducible in IE9, Firefox, Chrome
fields.summary: Alignment of the custom field of a subtask shown in parent issue is not appropriate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41701].
  {panel}

It would be great if the JIRA filter/query capability (workflows) also supported queries against the various sub-fields presented in the 'Source' sub tab.  Here is an explicit use case (Written as an agile story):

As a member of the software team using JIRA, I would like to filter (create a JIRA filter) against both custom labels and a git branch so to be able to see which JIRAs are fixed or not fixed against which git branch so that the necessary merge work be scheduled.

More explicitly, here is a filter that we currently use:

labels = SeamlessUpgrade AND resolution = fixed AND fixVersion = RT-7 ORDER BY created DESC

We need to be able to add to the above clause something like " AND gitBranch = master" so to sub select the above JIRAs for those that are only fixed on the git master branch.

Thanks much.
fields.summary: JIRA queries should support queries against the 'Source' sub-tab fields
Refreshable Exported Spreadsheet

Add some information about inactive workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41693].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms 
The post function "Copy Value From Field to Field Function" shows as "Only users with Create Issues permission can execute this transition." in the create transition.
While it might be show as the conditions in the transition like "Only users with Assignable User permission can execute this transition." in another transition if the custom field used in the copy value post functions is deleted.

Error message shows that custom field cannot be found when try to create issue. 
When you try to search the custom field id in jira workflow database, it can be found in the descriptor.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create an customer field *Client* and add it to the respective project screen and field scheme.
# Go to create transition of the workflow.
# Add post function Copy value from field *Client* to *Assignee*.(At this stage the post function should render correctly.)
# Delete custom field *Client*.
# Go to edit the same workflow transition again, you will see that the post function show as *"Only users with Create Issues permission can execute this transition."* instead.

Indexing does not solve the problem.
fields.summary: Post function "Copy Value From Field to Field Function" show as a conditions or validators instead when the custom field used is deleted.
Issue collector template "Got Feedback?" won't work properly without Description field in Create Issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41682].
  {panel}

http://<host>:2990/jira/rest/api/latest/issue/<issue id>/transitions?expand=transitions.fields

Always returns "fields":{} in the returned output (no fields).

De workflow in JIRA has been adapted to include some required field validators for certain issue transitions.
When the corresponding transition is performed in JIRA it shows/proves that the validators work (are active).

However, they are never returned in the above mentioned JIRA REST request?
fields.summary: JIRA REST API to retrieve issue transition details does not return required fields for transition.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41681].
  {panel}

While importing a project from a JIRA backup the import fails with the following error.
{noformat}
The import was aborted because there were too many errors. Some errors are listed below. For full details about the errors please see your logs. Please note that some elements have been created. You may want to consult your logs to see what caused the errors, delete the project, and perform the import again.
{noformat}

A few of the following errors can be found in the JIRA logs
{noformat}
2015-01-17 15:01:50,542 ProjectImport: CreateIssueRelatedData-10 ERROR admin 901x156x1 4bmvmr 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportPersister] DataAccessException occured while trying to create Entity type 'EntityProperty' . {id=10031, entityName=IssueProperty, entityId=10115, propertyKey=request.channel.type, value="Portal", created=2015-01-08 18:51:44.178, updated=2015-01-08 18:51:44.178}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:EntityProperty][id,10031][created,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][updated,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][entityId,10115][value,"Portal"][propertyKey,request.channel.type][entityName,IssueProperty] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.entity_property (ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, CREATED, UPDATED, json_value) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_entity_property"
  Detail: Key (id)=(10031) already exists.))
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:397)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.createValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportPersister.createEntity(DefaultProjectImportPersister.java:192)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.EntityPropertiesPersisterHandler$1.run(EntityPropertiesPersisterHandler.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.concurrent.BoundedExecutor$1.run(BoundedExecutor.java:50)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:695)
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:EntityProperty][id,10031][created,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][updated,2015-01-08 18:51:44.178][entityId,10115][value,"Portal"][propertyKey,request.channel.type][entityName,IssueProperty] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.entity_property (ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, CREATED, UPDATED, json_value) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_entity_property"
  Detail: Key (id)=(10031) already exists.))
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:200)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:165)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:83)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:554)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:540)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.create(GenericValue.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:392)
	... 7 more
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Get a JIRA backup from an instance with at least 20 Issue entities for a single project. e.g. create 10 issues with JIRA Service Desk. Each will add 3 issue entities
** You can verify that with the following SQL query
{code:SQL}select * from entity_property where entity_name = 'IssueProperty'{code}
# Import the project into another JIRA instance already containing data in the entity_property for the same IDs displayed in the query above

*Expected results*
JIRA Should import the project without any problems, using the next ID available for the entity_property table

*Actual results*
JIRA aborts the import as it tries to use the same IDs to add the respective Issue properties to the entity_properties table

*Workaround*
As a workaround you can change the EntityProperty IDs _directly in the entities.xml file of the backup_.

# Find entity IDs to change for the project. Run this at source JIRA Insert your project key into this query: {code:sql}
SELECT EP.id
FROM entity_property EP, jiraissue I, project P
WHERE EP.entity_name = 'IssueProperty' AND I.id = EP.entity_id
  AND P.id = I.project AND P.pkey = 'YOUR_PROJECT_KEY'
ORDER BY EP.id;
{code}
# Determine the current MAX(id), run this at target JIRA: {code:sql}
SELECT MAX(id) FROM entity_property
{code}
# Modify the XML backup file, replacing the entity_property IDs with sequential numbers higher than MAX(id) from the entity_property table.
#* Make sure you only modify XML nodes that begin with "<EntityProperty id=".  If the entities.xml file is large you may need to use vi or another editor that can handle really big files.
# Complete the import
# Shut down the target instance
# Reset the sequence_value_item table for EntityProperty types, run this at target JIRA: {code:sql}
UPDATE sequence_value_item SET seq_id = (SELECT MAX(id)+100 FROM entity_property) WHERE seq_name = 'EntityProperty';
{code}
# Restart the target instance

See KB for more detailed steps and simplified option to modify the XML backup file: [Project Import fails due to too many errors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Import+fails+due+to+too+many+errors]
fields.summary: Project import aborted due to too many errors
Provide display customizations of numeric data types in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41679].
  {panel}

Currently when we import an issue via CSV we can specify the Issue Key to be used.
After the Issues were imported the next issues created manually will follow the key numbers added by the CSV file.
For example:
A user would creates KEY-1 through JIRA, then someone imports KEY-10000 via CSV. The next issue created via JIRA will be KEY-10001.

Before [JIRA 6.2.6|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29762] the next issue created would be KEY-3 in the example above.

It would be great if we can add an option to the CSV import to allow users to choose the desired behaviour since both of these can be useful depending on the user's setup.
fields.summary: Add option to choose Issue key behaviour after CSV issue import
email notifications not working for some users on some status changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41676].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA doesn't provide any feedback through the gui whenever the attachment directory is not writable by the service user. This does lead to lost attachments. 

h4. Steps to reproduce

- Set the {{attachments}} directory to not be writeable. 
- Attach a file

You'll notice the gui will let you complete attaching the files, and they'll show up as attachments in JIRA, however, they will not actually be in the attachments directory. 

h4. Expected Result
- The gui should prompt the user that the attachments folder is not writable, and they should contact an admin.
fields.summary: Better Error Handling for Attachment Directory Permissions
Wiki markup embedded images are not shown in email notifications
Display work log in the comments

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
In JIRA, when you use JIRA's Internal Directory and an LDAP-based service for User Management, adding a group from Crowd with all-lowercase letters to Global Permissions and trying to remove it from there when having Crowd as the first directory to be searched into under "User Directories" panel.

*Expected behavior*
Have the group removed from Global Permissions in order not to have access granted to its members.

*Actual behavior*
JIRA does not remove the group from Global Permissions at all and neither generate any log or error message informing why the group wasn't removed.

Attached are screenshots of an environment that has this problem.

*Workaround*
The only workaround tested was to re-order the directories. This made possible for the group to be removed.

This was reported by a customer under JIRA 6.3.1 and reproduced internally under JIRA 6.3.13.
fields.summary: Misbehavior of "Global Permissions" when two groups with different case exist in two different directories
